snippet: In a 23-page letter, the European Commission described a “complex” arrangement involving Amazon subsidiaries and outlined why it is pursuing the case.
abstract: European Commission finds that tax deal between Amazon and Luxembourg may have broken European Union competition rules, allowing company to underpay its taxes for a decade or more; statement comes amid wider investigation into tax and competition violations by a number of multinationals; finding could result in tax clawback in the tens of millions of dollars.

byline.original: By JAMES KANTER and MARK SCOTT

lead_paragraph: In a 23-page letter, the European Commission described a “complex” arrangement involving Amazon subsidiaries and outlined why it is pursuing the case.

headline.main: Amazon’s Tax Deal With Luxembourg May Break Rules, E.U. Regulator Says
headline.print_headline: Amazon’s Tax Deal With Luxembourg May Break Rules, E.U. Regulator Says
